TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR PROJECT PREPARATION 
A.  Justification 
1.  The transaction (project preparatory) technical assistance (TRTA) is required to 
(i)  ensure the proposed project complies with the Asian Development Bank (ADB) 
policy requirements including technical, economic and financial, procurement, 
governance, poverty, gender, environment and social safeguards; 
(ii)  provide support to the Ministry of Environment and Energy (MEE) to maximize 
project readiness and reduce start-up delays by undertaking advance contracting 
actions; and 
(iii)  assist MEE by working directly with the feasibility study team to streamline inputs 
into the project design and environmental impact assessment (EIA).

Assistance Special Fund (TASF-VI). The government will provide counterpart support in the form 
of domestic transportation, provision of office space, and other in-kind contributions. The detailed 
cost estimate is presented in Table A3.2.

D.  Consulting Services 
4.  Eleven individuals (9 international consultants and 3 national consultants) providing 31 
person-months of input will be engaged to undertake the technical assistance project. Table A3.3 
summarizes the consulting services requirement for the individuals. The consultants will be 
recruited using Individual Consultants Selection method with lumpsum contracts. The consultants 
will be mobilized to help ADB adequately address the following aspects relating to the ensuing 
grant project and undertake the following tasks, among others: (i) detailed grant executing agency 
and implementing agency capacity assessment, and suggested remedial action plan to build 
executing agency and implementing agency capacity to minimize procurement and financial 
management risks; (ii) proposed or indicative grant related procurement plan with suggested level 
of priority or, if applicable, postreview based on executing agency and implementing agency 
capacity assessment; and (iii) indicative implementation schedule with proposed sequencing of 
consultant recruitment and procurement bidding and awarding.

5.  The outline terms of reference for the TRTA consultants are described in paras. 6 to 15.  
6.  Solid Waste Management Specialist (international, 3 person-months). Will be the lead 
technical specialist of the TRTA team. He or she will (i) review and guide the feasibility study, 
project scoping findings, and bidding documents prepared by MEE consultants; (ii) identify 
sustainable waste management solutions for the project considering economy and efficiency of 
implementation; (iii) provide technical inputs and quality control over project design, including 
institutional capacity building, and introduce international best practices; and (iv) support analysis 
of carbon emission reduction related to landfill or waste-to-energy components. Work experience 
of 15 years and postgraduate degree in engineering, planning, or related field preferred.

7.  Environmental  Specialist  (international,  3  person-months).  He/she  will  (i)  guide 
government’s EIA for purpose of clearances and permits and address all issues as per ADB’s 
environmental  requirements;  (ii)  prepare  EIA  in  accordance  with  ADB’s  Safeguards  Policy 
Statement, 2009; (iii) ensure that land reclamation and dredging avoid impacts to biodiversity, 
and  WTE  facility  meets  strict  international  emission  standards;  (iv)  prepare  a  detailed 
environmental  management  plan  to  minimize  and/or  avoid  environmental  risks;  (v)  identify 
institutional capacity gaps in environmental monitoring and regulatory enforcement of relevant 
standards  associated  with  the  project;  (vi)  support  institutional  capacity  building  of  the 
Environmental Protection Agency; (vii) ensure environmental measures are incorporated into 
relevant contracts, and support climate change measures in the design; and (viii) work closely 
with other members to prepare a project meeting ADB’s funding requirements. Work experience 
of 15 years and postgraduate degree in environmental science, or related field preferred.  
8.  Information,  Education,  and  Communication  (IEC)  and  Community  Sanitation 
Specialist  (international,  2  person-months).  Will  design  IEC  and  community  sanitation 
components, engage in preproject community consultations, and prepare the Community Action 
and Participation Plan. Will work closely with the social development and gender specialist to 
incorporate  good  practices  in  other  development  partner  community-based  island  waste 
management projects. Work experience of 15 years and postgraduate degree in communications, 
sociology, or related field preferred.  
9.  Social Development and Gender Specialist (national, 2 person-months). Will undertake 
social, poverty, and gender-related assessments in accordance with ADB guidelines. This will 
include undertaking gender analysis and collection of sex-disaggregated baseline data. The 
specialist will ascertain the labor distribution (sex disaggregated) at various stages of the waste 
management cycle and any informal recycling practices that are prevalent in the Greater Male 
area to identify project components that will have positive and negative impacts on women in 
particular. She or he will propose mitigation measures for any negative impacts on women arising 
from the project and suggest ways to improve women’s livelihood through project interventions.1 
Work experience of 10 years and postgraduate degree in sociology or related field preferred.  
10.  Project  Economist  (Urban)  (international,  2  person-months).  Will  lead  economic 
assessment for the proposed project under the TRTA. He or she will work closely with the 
government, MEE feasibility consultants, and other members of the TRTA team to support and 
help prepare a project meeting ADB’s funding requirements. He or she will conduct rigorous 
economic analysis in compliance with ADB requirements including the 10 Key Areas of Economic 
Analysis of Investment projects. Work experience of 15 years and postgraduate degree in 
economics preferred.  
11.   Financial Specialist (international, 2 person-months). He/she will (i) prepare and update 
project cost estimates and financing plan; (ii) conduct financial management assessment of the 
executing and implementing agencies; (iii) conduct financial viability evaluation of the project; (iv) 
conduct financial analysis and sustainability assessment of the executing and implementing 
agencies; (v) design funds flow and disbursement arrangements; (vi) design reporting and 
auditing arrangements; and (vii) design financial covenants and financial management action 
plan. He/she will conduct such work in accordance with ADB's technical guidance note (TGN) for 
Financial Management Assessment (2015), 2015 TGN for project financial reporting and auditing,

12.  Urban  Climate  Change  and  Disaster  Risk  Reduction  Specialist  (international,  3 
person-months). Will integrate climate change and disaster risk reduction into project design. Also 
support analysis related to potential carbon emission reduction components including landfill 
closure and WTE facilities under the project. Expert to assess needs and other donor support for 
(i) climate change and natural hazard mapping, (ii) strategic environmental assessment, (iii) flood 
mapping,  and  (iv)  greenhouse  gas  emissions  reduction  calculation  with  baseline.  Work 
experience of 15 years and postgraduate in planning, engineering, or related field preferred.  
13.  Institutional Specialist (Municipal Solid Waste Management) (international, 2 person-
months). Will  lead  the institutional  assessment  of Waste  Management  Corporation  Limited 
(WAMCO), MEE, and island councils for the proposed project under the TRTA. Work experience 
of 15 years and postgraduate degree in public policy, planning, or related field preferred.  
14.  Procurement Expert (international, 3 person-months). He or she will (i) review and guide 
the  feasibility  study,  project  scoping  findings,  and  bidding  documents  prepared  by  MEE 
consultants;  (ii)  assess  procurement  capacity  and  procurement  system  of  executing  and 
implementing agencies, and identify risks and capacity development requirements and mitigation 
measures; (iii) prepare a Procurement Plan following ADB procurement requirements; (iv) perform 
an assessment/survey for both international and national markets for competitive biddings; (v) 
provide hand-holding support and training to agencies and support project readiness for smooth 
start-up;  and  (vi)  assess  fraud  and  corruption  risks.  Work  experience  of  15  years  and 
postgraduate degree in engineering or related field preferred.  
15.   Environmental Engineer (national, 5 person-months). The environmental engineer will 
be the local technical specialist of the technical assistance team. He/she will work closely with 
others and liaise with members of the TRTA team. Work experience of 15 years and postgraduate 
degree in civil or environmental engineering, or related field preferred.  
E.  Implementation Arrangements 
16.   The  Ministry  of  Finance  and  Treasury  will  be  the  executing  agency.  A  project 
management unit consisting of officials from MEE and WAMCO will be set up under the MEE to 
coordinate project activities. The proposed TA processing and implementation schedule is listed 
in Table A3.4. The TA amount will be disbursed in accordance with the ADB Technical Assistance 
Handbook (2010, as amended from time to time). 
Table A3.4: Technical Assistance Processing and Implementation Schedule
